snippet: An anecdote from “The Partnership: The Making of Goldman Sachs,” a book by Charles D. Ellis, shows that when Goldman was smaller, no one could argue that it did not do a good job of representing clients.
abstract: An anecdote from “The Partnership: The Making of Goldman Sachs,” a book by Charles D. Ellis, shows that when Goldman was smaller, no one could argue that it did not do a good job of representing clients.
